extracted_playbook.title: Provide Regular User Training and Exercises
extracted_playbook.description: Conduct regular training and exercises for users, focusing on phishing email awareness to prevent initial access intrusion events.

extracted_playbook.title: Enforce Phishing-Resistant MFA
extracted_playbook.description: Implement phishing-resistant multi-factor authentication (MFA) to enhance security against unauthorized access.

extracted_playbook.title: Place Domain Admin Accounts in Protected Users Group
extracted_playbook.description: Prevent caching of password hashes locally by placing domain admin accounts in the protected users group, enforcing Kerberos AES authentication.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Credential Guard for Windows 10 and Server 2016
extracted_playbook.description: Enable Credential Guard to protect against credential theft. Refer to Microsoft documentation for managing Windows Defender Credential Guard.

extracted_playbook.title: Enable Protected Process Light for LSA on Windows Server 2012R2
extracted_playbook.description: Enable Protected Process Light for Local Security Authority (LSA) to enhance security on Windows Server 2012R2.

extracted_playbook.title: Refrain from Storing Plaintext Credentials in Scripts
extracted_playbook.description: Avoid storing plaintext credentials in scripts to prevent unauthorized access and privilege escalation.

extracted_playbook.title: Upgrade to Windows Server 2019 or Greater and Windows 10 or Greater
extracted_playbook.description: Upgrade to Windows Server 2019 or greater and Windows 10 or greater to benefit from enhanced security features.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Zero Trust Network Architecture
extracted_playbook.description: Prioritize implementing a Zero Trust network architecture that leverages secure cloud services, modern identity management, and centralized cybersecurity data access.

extracted_playbook.title: Engage Executive Leadership on Security Risks
extracted_playbook.description: Encourage IT leadership to discuss with executive leadership the business risks of not implementing critical security controls such as MFA.
